Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, kawetsriyanto! Thank you for visiting our bounty & airdrop. We are currently accumulating data for the Excel spreadsheet. We promise to get back to you in the very near future. For the application form, did you mean the method to participate in the bounty, or the advertisement? Most of our participation in the ads are done by putting in your post's URL on this link; https://ico.blocvehicle.com/bounty/registAirdrop Please let us know if you have any trouble. For your question, we plan to first launch the program in the Asian region first, then will move on to U.S., then Europe. Of the ninety million driving vehicles in the U.S., fifty percent is consisted of rentals. This is why by initiating our project and building up a strong basis in the Asian region, we will move on to the U.S. next. The European market is also comparable in its potential as well, since of the annual one point two billion travelers, more than half of them visit European regions. By creating an alliance with existing businesses in the regions, we plan to have our business effectively conducted in all of the three markets. This is why we have 15% of the total supply of tokens allocated to the 'country partnering', so that the said businesses will also be able to become participants in our network as well. Ultimately, our plan will breathe new life into the VCL tokens, and help create a more diverse and active economy system.

Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, 3dyx! The input of the car data will most likely to be uploaded by the owner of the vehicle himself/herself, via the BlocVehicle app. This will guarantee a steady flow of information, with compensation in the form of our VCL token as a reward! Third parties, such as insurance companies or car repair shops may be able to participate in the uploading process as well, but only with the approval from the customer/owner. There are details explained in our litepaper/whitepaper, translated into Chinese, English, Korean, and Japanese on our website, but feel free to ask us any more details that come across your mind. Thank you for your interest in our project.

Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, 3dyx! What you are saying is right. Without a regulated control from a third-party, price of the cars may fluctuate. What is important to note, though, is that the current centralized market has no control over the credibility of provided information - we get fraudulent deals, unacceptable rates, and 'lemon cars' happen more often than we want. If, however, we only had comparable size of car data uploaded to the blockchain network, be it six months' or an year's worth of accumulated information, the transparency in the information that we would get will be unmatched to what we are given right now. Part of what we plan to achieve is to make it so that the car owners may have the option to choose whether to have third parties (repair shops, maintenance centers, insurance companies, etc) upload their car history to the network or not. Since it is not an intermediary uploading the data, the information will have higher credibility than what we get when we ask about a car at a dealership. This is one of the main belief; that ultimately, drivers all around the world will benefit from the clear, transparent car data.

Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, heywebster! We believe that we are setting the first stones to the creation of a next-gen platform. It might not work as intended, it might be altered in some way, it might face difficult-to-overcome obstacles, but we believe that when the time is right, an ultimate platform that can enable people to conduct a trade of their second-hand commodities - not only cars, buses, but all of your second-hand items, including bags, yachts, motorcycles and what not! - will be created! This is our first pitch, and we might need more than a couple to make this work. Spread the word!

Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, 5o5ky, thank you for your reply! What's important is that we have more than eighteen solid years of experience in the IT field, and that we are not delving into a new field without any background. This is, I think, strengthened by the fact that we have five other similar companies in a consortium with us, all of them vets in the expertise. What you are saying is right, though, because without any financial backup, it would almost be impossible to build what we plan to.. and even if we did, it would be too shaky to make it sustainable. You need not worry! Our consortium is consisted of five companies who are successful in their business enterprise themselves! Although parts of the contents will not be completely eligible in English, here are the URLs for each of our consortium, so that you may check them to your heart's content. 1) Saltware -> http://www.saltware.co.kr/ 2) Softbase -> http://www.softbase.co.kr/ 3) Compass Systems -> http://www.compass21.com/ 4) Adweb Communication -> http://www.adweb.co.kr/ 5) ICK(Internet Commerce Korea) -> http://www.ink.co.kr/intro_ceo.html

Author: BlocVehicle
Title: [ANN][PRE-ICO] BlocVehicle - Make Your Own Car History
Body: Hello, Fu.Sin! It is true that there are many other programs on the market right now, that plans to share car data openly and publicly. Oracle, DB2, and Sybase, to give out some examples. It may seem similar to what we have in store, but the main difference is that these are still, a part of the DBMS(Database Management System) - a centralized infrastructure that is still susceptible to modification of data. During our 18 years of experience in the IT fields, we have seen too many admins or moderators that had influence on what information that they could provide. The only technical solution to this problem - the one that can provide complete immunity from data corruption - that we have found lies in the basis of blockchain technology. We are certain that one day in the future, all transactions will eventually have its own form of a P2P network-based practice. This is the reason why we are carrying forward the project, to help set up a foundation of some sort as a preparation. Please let us know if you have any more questions! Thank you for your interest in our project.
